TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit ScrollPattern/ScrollPatternInformation extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides access to the property values of a object using its or accessors.
Gets a value that indicates whether the UI Automation element can scroll horizontally.
Docs.value: if the UI Automation element can scroll horizontally; otherwise . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be dynamic. For example, the content area of the UI Automation element might not be larger than the current viewable area, meaning <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern.ScrollPatternInformation.HorizontallyScrollable%2A> is `false`. However, resizing the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element or adding child items can increase the bounds of the content area beyond the viewable area, indicating that <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern.ScrollPatternInformation.HorizontallyScrollable%2A> is `true`.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern>control pattern is obtained from a UI Automation element and is then used to horizontally scroll the element the requested amount.
[!code-csharp[UIAScrollPattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/CSharp/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAScrollPattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.vb#101)] [!code-csharp[UIAScrollPattern_snip#107](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/CSharp/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.cs#107)] [!code-vb[UIAScrollPattern_snip#107](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.vb#107)]

Docs.summary: Gets the current horizontal scroll position.
Docs.value: The horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the UI Automation element. The default value is 0.0.

remarks.format:
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern> object obtained from a target control is passed into a function that retrieves the current horizontal and vertical scroll percentages of the viewable region within the content area.
[!code-csharp[UIAScrollPattern_snip#1045](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/CSharp/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.cs#1045)] [!code-vb[UIAScrollPattern_snip#1045](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.vb#1045)]

Docs.summary: Gets the current horizontal view size.
Docs.value: The horizontal size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the UI Automation element. The default value is 100.0.

remarks.format:
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern> object obtained from a target control is passed into a function that retrieves the current vertical and horizontal sizes of the viewable region as percentages of the total content area.
[!code-csharp[UIAScrollPattern_snip#1055](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/CSharp/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.cs#1055)] [!code-vb[UIAScrollPattern_snip#1055](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.vb#1055)]

Docs.summary: Retrieves a value that indicates whether the UI Automation element can scroll vertically.
Docs.value: if the UI Automation element can scroll horizontally; otherwise . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be dynamic. For example, the content area of the UI Automation element might not be larger than the current viewable area, meaning <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern.ScrollPatternInformation.VerticallyScrollable%2A> is `false`. However, resizing the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element or adding child items can increase the bounds of the content area beyond the viewable area, indicating that <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern.ScrollPatternInformation.VerticallyScrollable%2A> is `true`.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollPattern>control pattern is obtained from a UI Automation element and is then used to vertically scroll the element the requested amount.
[!code-csharp[UIAScrollPattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/CSharp/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAScrollPattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.vb#101)] [!code-csharp[UIAScrollPattern_snip#108](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/CSharp/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.cs#108)] [!code-vb[UIAScrollPattern_snip#108](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAScrollPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAScrollPattern_snippets.vb#108)]

Docs.summary: Gets the current vertical scroll position.
Docs.value: The vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the UI Automation element. The default value is 0.0.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets the current vertical view size.
Docs.value: The vertical size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the UI Automation element. The default value is 100.0.
